splattr 0.0.0.9004

HCL data

Source: R/table.R
hcl_dataframe.Rd

These function help you consider colors in terms of their hue, chroma, and luminance (HCL). You will need the colorspace package to run these functions.

hcl_dataframe(colors)

hcl_table(colors, decimals = 0)

Arguments

colors

character vector of R colors. Can be hex codes, etc.
decimals

numeric number of decimal places for values in table.

Value

hcl_dataframe()

data.frame with columns: color, hue, chroma luminance.

hcl_table()

An object with S3 class gt_tbl.

Details

  • hcl_dataframe(): get a data frame with HCL data

  • hcl_table(): get a formatted gt table; you will need the gt package.

Examples

  # return data
  hcl_dataframe("red")
#>   color      hue   chroma luminance
#> 1   red 12.17395 179.0408  53.24059
  hcl_dataframe("#FF0000")
#>     color      hue   chroma luminance
#> 1 #FF0000 12.17395 179.0408  53.24059
  hcl_dataframe(c("red", "green"))
#>   color       hue   chroma luminance
#> 1   red  12.17395 179.0408  53.24059
#> 2 green 127.72353 135.7811  87.73510

  # return formatted table
  hcl_table(c("red", "green"))
